faqs.faq: What activities to get involved in
faqs.answer: Now is your chance to branch out, try new things, discover passions, and make new friends! Your high school counselor may have a list of all the extracurriculars offered by your new school. Take a look, and take note of the clubs and teams you might want to try. Specifically for MVHS: an updated list of clubs and information about sports and other programs may be found on the MVHS website.

faqs.faq: What are clubs and how can I get involved?
faqs.answer: Clubs are a great way for students to participate in activities they enjoy, learn new skills, and meet new people. High school clubs can cover a wide variety of topics, from math to skiing to protecting the environment and more. Clubs are places to meet people with unique interest which may just align with yours. Clubs will be on the website, and you can find a list of clubs on the MVHS website or contact the club president(s) via email!

faqs.faq: Which AP courses should I consider taking?
faqs.answer: Our schools offer AP classes to most students starting sophomore year. These classes are more advanced and allow you to earn college credit in the form of AP testing. Inquire about these classes as a high school freshman. Learning about AP classes early on, you’ll know what to do when the time comes to register for them. Consider taking AP classes only in the subjects you are interested in to avoid burning out or taking too many classes.

faqs.faq: Where can I get help if I'm struggling with a class?
faqs.answer: There is no shame in asking for help. Most, if not all, students in high school need help with their classes at one point or another. Our school offers tutors as well as tutorial periods so that you can drop by teachers rooms

faqs.faq: Which courses do I need to make sure I graduate?
faqs.answer: When you meet with your high school counselor, make sure you’re registered for classes on the right track for graduation. Though you are only a high school freshman, it's good to make a plan and know where you're headed. In your MVLA planner, there is a list of requirements for high school graduation, and CSU entrance.

faqs.faq: What other resources does MVHS have?
faqs.answer: MVHS has many resources that will help students, including counseling, tutoring, activities, college counseling, and more!
